description: Gets information about a multicast group.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The ID of the multicast group.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The arn of the multicast group.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The ID of the multicast group.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the multicast group.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the new resource.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the multicast group.

nested_items.name: DlClass
nested_items.description: DlClass for LoRaWAM, valid values are ClassB and ClassC.

nested_items.name: NumberOfDevicesRequested
nested_items.description: Number of devices that are requested to be associated with the multicast group.

nested_items.name: NumberOfDevicesInGroup
nested_items.description: Number of devices that are associated to the multicast group.

nested_items.name: ParticipatingGateways
nested_items.description: Specify the list of gateways to which you want to send the multicast downlink messages. The multicast message will be sent to each gateway in the list, with the transmission interval as the time interval between each message.

nested_items.name: GatewayList
nested_items.description: The list of gateways that you want to use for sending the multicast downlink message. Each downlink message will be sent to all the gateways in the list in the order that you provided. If the gateway list is empty, then AWS IoT Core for LoRaWAN chooses the gateways that were most recently used by the devices to send an uplink message.

nested_items.name: TransmissionInterval
nested_items.description: The duration of time in milliseconds for which AWS IoT Core for LoRaWAN will wait before transmitting the multicast payload to the next gateway in the list.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: Created at timestamp for the resource.
